title: Biden says Iran-backed militants killed 3 US servicemen in drone attack
description: Three US service members have been killed by a drone attack on a military base carried out by “radical Iran-backed militant groups” near the Syria border, the White House said on Sunday. President Joe Biden said the US would “hold all those responsible to account at a time and in a manner of our choosing”.

description: A DUP spokesperson said they do not comment on internal meetings. A 27-year-old man has been charged with the murder of Kevin Conway in Belfast. title: Ian Blackford insists Nicola Sturgeon and Humza Yousaf trusted by public as Labour surges to biggest lead over SNP for a decade
description: Ian Blackford has insisted Nicola Sturgeon and Humza Yousaf are trusted by the public as a poll found Labour had surged to its biggest lead over the SNP for a decade. Research by Nostat put Labour on 36 per cent, up three points since its last poll in October, with the SNP on 33 per cent, down four points.

title: Humza Yousaf urged to order ministerial code probe into himself over Whatsapp scandal
description: Humza Yousaf has been urged to order an investigation into himself over statements made about deleted WhatsApp messages. It follows his appearance before the UK Covid-19 Inquiry, where the First Minister appeared to admit deleting WhatsApp messages, despite previously claiming otherwise.

title: UK ‘undaunted’ after Houthis target HMS Diamond, Shapps says
description: Grant Shapps has said the UK remains “undaunted” after Iran-backed Houthis targeted the HMS Diamond in the Red Sea during their latest round of strikes. Crew on the ship shot down a drone deployed by the Yemen-based group, which appears undeterred despite UK-US military action against the rebels earlier this week.
